com.samskivert.util

Class ClassUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.util.ClassUtil

  • public class ClassUtil
extends Object
    Class object related utility routines.

    This code was adapted from code provided by Paul Hosler in an article for Java Report Online.

        public ClassUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • classIsAccessible

        public static boolean classIsAccessible(Class<?> clazz)
        Parameters:
        clazz - a class.
        Returns:
        true if the class is accessible, false otherwise. Presently returns true if the class is declared public.

      • getFields

        public static Field[] getFields(Class<?> clazz)
        Get the fields contained in the class and its superclasses.

      • getFields

        public static void getFields(Class<?> clazz,
                             List<Field> addTo)
        Add all the fields of the specifed class (and its ancestors) to the list. Note, if we are running in a sandbox, this will only enumerate public members.

      • getParameterTypesFrom

        public static Class<?>[] getParameterTypesFrom(Object[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - an object array.
        Returns:
        an array of Class objects representing the classes of the objects in the given Object array. If args is null, a zero-length Class array is returned. If an element in args is null, then Void.TYPE is the corresponding Class in the return array.

      • compatibleClasses

        public static boolean compatibleClasses(Class<?>[] lhs,
                                        Class<?>[] rhs)
        Tells whether instances of the classes in the 'rhs' array could be used as parameters to a reflective method invocation whose parameter list has types denoted by the 'lhs' array.
        Parameters:
        lhs - Class array representing the types of the formal parameters of a method.
        rhs - Class array representing the types of the actual parameters of a method. A null value or Void.TYPE is considered to match a corresponding Object or array class in lhs, but not a primitive.
        Returns:
        true if compatible, false otherwise.

      • getAccessibleMethodFrom

        public static Method getAccessibleMethodFrom(Class<?> clazz,
                                             String methodName,
                                             Class<?>[] parameterTypes)
        Searches for the method with the given name and formal parameter types that is in the nearest accessible class in the class hierarchy, starting with clazz's superclass. The superclass and implemented interfaces of clazz are searched, then their superclasses, etc. until a method is found. Returns null if there is no such method.
        Parameters:
        clazz - a class.
        methodName - name of a method.
        parameterTypes - Class array representing the types of a method's formal parameters.
        Returns:
        the nearest method located, or null if there is no such method.

      • primitiveEquivalentOf

        public static Class<?> primitiveEquivalentOf(Class<?> clazz)
        Parameters:
        clazz - a Class.
        Returns:
        the class's primitive equivalent, if clazz is a primitive wrapper. If clazz is primitive, returns clazz. Otherwise, returns null.

      • objectEquivalentOf

        public static Class<?> objectEquivalentOf(Class<?> clazz)
        Returns:
        the class's object equivalent if the class is a primitive type.

      • primitiveIsAssignableFrom

        public static boolean primitiveIsAssignableFrom(Class<?> lhs,
                                                Class<?> rhs)
        Tells whether an instance of the primitive class represented by 'rhs' can be assigned to an instance of the primitive class represented by 'lhs'.
        Parameters:
        lhs - assignee class.
        rhs - assigned class.
        Returns:
        true if compatible, false otherwise. If either argument is null, or one of the parameters does not represent a primitive (e.g. Byte.TYPE), returns false.
